item.title: 澳大利亚监管机构推动市场运营商 ASX 提高收费透明度和加强竞争
item.description: 澳大利亚企业监管机构周二表示，为促进竞争，该国股市运营商将被要求公布与外国供应商的清算和结算费用比较，并说明任何费用增长的理由。【原文：Australia's corporate regulator said on Tuesday the country's stock market operator would be required to publish a comparison of clearing and settlement fees against foreign providers and justify any fee increases, in a bid to promote competition.】

item.title: 制药公司因Stelara生物仿制药合同违约起诉三星Bioepis公司
item.description: 强生（Johnson & Johnson）周一表示，该公司已对三星生物医药公司（Samsung Bioepis）提起诉讼，指控其违反了与该制药商就推出强生公司自身免疫药物 Stelara 的生物仿制药所达成的合同协议。【原文：Johnson & Johnson said on Monday it had filed a lawsuit against Samsung Bioepis for breaching its contract agreement with the drugmaker over the launch of a biosimilar to Stelara, J&J's autoimmune drug.】

item.title: 英特尔称首批两台新型 ASML 机器已投入生产，并取得积极成果
item.description: 英特尔公司周一表示，ASML Holding 公司的首批两台尖端设备已在其工厂 "投入生产"，早期数据显示它们比上一代设备更加可靠。【原文：Intel on Monday said that the first two cutting-edge machines from ASML Holding are "in production" at its factories, with early data indicating they are more reliable than the previous generation of machines.】

item.title: 副总统表示，圭亚那将在 3 月底之前等待埃克森公司的天然气开发计划
item.description: 圭亚那副总统告诉路透社记者，圭亚那政府希望由美国石油巨头埃克森美孚牵头的财团能在 3 月底之前向官员们介绍开发近海天然气的计划。【原文：Guyana's government expects a consortium led by U.S. oil major Exxon Mobil to brief officials by the end of March on plans to develop offshore gas, the country's vice president told Reuters.】

item.title: 科特拉能源公司因产量增加而实现超预期的季度利润，并上调股息
item.description: 由于石油和天然气公司受益于石油和天然气液（NGLs）产量的增加，Coterra Energy 公司周一公布的第四季度利润超过了华尔街的预期。【原文：Coterra Energy beat Wall Street estimates for fourth-quarter profit on Monday, as the oil and gas company benefited from higher oil and natural gas liquids (NGLs) production.】

item.title: 受洛杉矶野火影响，Public Storage 预测 2025 年财务和财务状况不乐观
item.description: 房地产投资信托公司 Public Storage 周一预测 2025 年的运营资金将低于华尔街预期，原因是受到洛杉矶野火后定价限制的影响。【原文：Real estate investment trust Public Storage forecast funds from operations for 2025 below Wall Street expectations on Monday, weighed down by pricing restrictions following the Los Angeles wildfires.】

item.title: 早间交易和平希望刺破阴霾，但安全交易占主导地位
item.description: 亚洲市场前瞻【原文：A look at the day ahead in Asian markets.】

item.title: 美国称 OKX 加密交易所运营商认罪，将支付超过 5.04 亿美元的赔偿金
item.description: 美国联邦检察官周一表示，OKX 加密货币交易所的经营者承认违反了美国反洗钱法，经营未经许可的汇款业务，并同意支付超过 5.04 亿美元的罚款。【原文：The operator of the OKX cryptocurrency exchange pleaded guilty on Monday to violating U.S. anti-money laundering laws by operating an unlicensed money transmitting business, and agreed to pay more than $504 million in penalties, federal prosecutors said.】

item.title: 教育科技公司在诉讼中称，谷歌的人工智能预览侵蚀了互联网
item.description: 一家美国教育技术公司在周一提起的诉讼中称，Alphabet 旗下的谷歌互联网搜索引擎正在侵蚀对原创内容的需求，并削弱出版商与其人工智能生成的概述竞争的能力。【原文：Alphabet's Google internet search engine is eroding demand for original content and undermining publishers' ability to compete with its artificial intelligence-generated overviews, a U.S. educational technology company said in a lawsuit filed on Monday.】

item.title: 连锁餐厅 Jack in the Box 首席执行官达林-哈里斯辞职
item.description: 快餐连锁店 Jack in the Box 周一表示，其首席执行官达林-哈里斯（Darin Harris）即将卸任，但仍将担任顾问至 3 月 14 日。【原文：Fast-food restaurant chain Jack in the Box said on Monday its CEO, Darin Harris, is stepping down but will remain as a consultant through March 14.】

item.title: Zoom Communications 预测全年收入下滑
item.description: 周一，Zoom Communications 预计全年营收低于华尔街预期，这表明随着雇主逐渐放弃混合工作模式，对其各种会议工具的需求疲软。【原文：Zoom Communications forecast annual revenue below Wall Street estimates on Monday, in a sign of weak demand for its wide range of conferencing tools as employers gradually move away from hybrid work models.】

item.title: 独家报道摩根大通高管复职后呼吁 "更加努力
item.description: 在摩根大通首席执行官杰米-戴蒙（Jamie Dimon）蔑视员工对其五天返回办公室政策的反对后几天，摩根大通的一位高管对数千名员工说，他希望 "更加努力"。【原文：A JPMorgan Chase executive told thousands of employees he wanted "more hustle" days after the bank's CEO Jamie Dimon scorned staff pushback against its five-day return-to-office policy.】

item.title: 华尔街日报》报道：人工智能初创公司 Anthropic 完成 35 亿美元融资
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》周一报道，人工智能初创公司 Anthropic 希望在最新一轮融资中筹集 35 亿美元，这将使聊天机器人 Claude 背后的初创公司估值达到 615 亿美元。【原文：AI startup Anthropic is looking to raise $3.5 billion in its latest funding round which would value the startup behind the chatbot Claude at $61.5 billion, the Wall Street Journal reported on Monday.】

item.title: 特朗普称美国 "按时 "对加拿大和墨西哥征收关税
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普总统在周一被问及在下周暂停对加拿大和墨西哥商品征收关税的最后期限到来时是否会对此类商品征收关税时，重申了他的观点，即美国受到了邻国和盟国的虐待。【原文：President Donald Trump, asked on Monday whether tariffs would be placed on Canadian and Mexican goods when the deadline for a pause on such action arrives next week, reiterated his view that the United States had been mistreated by its neighbors and allies.】

item.title: 美国环保署批准中西部地区扩建计划后，石油贸易组织推动美国制定国家乙醇政策
item.description: 在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普的政府周五表示将在美国中西部某些州扩大乙醇汽油的销售之后，美国石油学会贸易组织周一敦促美国在全国范围内制定有关乙醇汽油的政策。【原文：The American Petroleum Institute trade group on Monday pressed for a nationwide policy on higher-ethanol blends of gasoline after the President Donald Trump's administration said on Friday it would move ahead with expanded sales of the product in certain Midwestern states.】

item.title: 美国贸易代表办公室建议向进入美国港口的中国船只收取高达150万美元的费用
item.description: 美国贸易代表办公室提议对进入美国港口的中国制造船只收取高达 150 万美元的费用，作为对中国在全球造船、海运和物流行业日益增长的主导地位进行调查的一部分。【原文：The U.S. Trade Representative's office has proposed charging up to $1.5 million for Chinese-built vessels entering U.S. ports as part of its investigation into China's growing domination of the global shipbuilding, maritime and logistics sectors.】

item.title: 据 CNBC 报道，摩根大通首席执行官杰米-戴蒙（Jamie Dimon）重申，尽管行业发生了变化，但摩根大通仍将致力于发展可持续发展投资（DEI）。
item.description: 摩根大通首席执行官杰米-戴蒙（Jamie Dimon）周一在接受 CNBC 采访时表示，摩根大通将继续在多元化方面做出努力，尽管公司在这些举措上出现了广泛的退缩。【原文：JPMorgan Chase will continue its diversity efforts, its CEO Jamie Dimon said in an interview with CNBC on Monday, despite a broader corporate retreat from such initiatives.】

item.title: 普京召开稀土金属会议，旨在大幅提高产量
item.description: 克里姆林宫表示，俄罗斯总统弗拉基米尔-普京周一与官员们举行了一次会议，讨论稀土金属生产问题，他称稀土金属是对俄罗斯未来竞争力和经济发展至关重要的战略储备。【原文：Russian President Vladimir Putin held a meeting with officials on Monday to discuss rare earth metals production, which he described as a strategic reserve vital for Russia's future competitiveness and economic development, the Kremlin said.】

item.title: 破产的手工艺品零售商 Joann 关闭所有门店
item.description: 手工艺品零售商 Joann Inc 计划破产关闭其所有门店，因为未能找到愿意保留这家拥有 82 年历史的公司在美国 800 家零售店中部分门店的买家。【原文：Crafts retailer Joann Inc plans to close all of its stores in bankruptcy, after failing to find a buyer willing to preserve some of the 82-year-old company's 800 U.S. retail locations.】

item.title: 古巴顶级雪茄制造商打破纪录，2024 年销售额达 8.27 亿美元
item.description: 古巴顶级雪茄制造商哈瓦那斯公司（Habanos）周一表示，由于中国和亚洲其他地区快速增长的市场带来了大量收入，该公司奢华雪茄的销售额在 2024 年飙升至创纪录的 8.27 亿美元。【原文：Cuba's top cigar maker Habanos said on Monday that sales of the company's luxurious smokes had soared to a record $827 million in 2024 as revenue poured in from fast-growing markets in China and elsewhere in Asia.】

item.title: Anthropic 推出先进的人工智能混合推理模型
item.description: Anthropic 公司周一推出了一款先进的人工智能模型，该模型可以更快地做出反应或显示其逐步推理过程，它希望在生成式人工智能行业获得竞争优势。【原文：Anthropic on Monday launched an advanced AI model that can produce faster responses or display its step-by-step reasoning process, as it looks to gain a competitive edge in the generative artificial intelligence industry.】

item.title: 研究显示，美联储有望对通胀和就业市场状况做出强烈反应
item.description: 根据旧金山联储周一公布的研究报告，投资者和经济学家预计美国央行将对通胀和劳动力市场的变化做出 "强烈而系统性的 "反应，这凸显了当前金融市场对美国经济数据的敏感性。【原文：Investors and economists expect the U.S. central bank to respond "strongly and systematically" to changes in inflation and the labor market, according to research published on Monday by the San Francisco Fed that underscores the current sensitivity of financial markets to U.S. economic data.】

item.title: 利润创历史新高，伯克希尔哈撒韦股价再创新高
item.description: 沃伦-巴菲特（Warren Buffett）经营的伯克希尔-哈撒韦公司（Berkshire Hathaway）在保险业务改善的推动下，公布了有史以来最高的季度利润，该公司股价周一升至创纪录水平。【原文：Berkshire Hathaway shares rose to a record on Monday after the conglomerate run by Warren Buffett posted its highest-ever quarterly profit, driven by improvement in insurance operations.】

item.title: Bybit 15 亿美元失窃案后最大的黑客攻击和抢劫案
item.description: 加密货币交易所 Bybit 上周称，黑客窃取了价值约 15 亿美元的数字代币，研究人员称这是有史以来最大的加密货币抢劫案。【原文：Cryptocurrency exchange Bybit said last week hackers had stolen digital tokens worth around $1.5 billion, in what researchers called the biggest crypto heist of all time.】

item.title: 美国法院维持对 Theranos 创始人伊丽莎白-霍尔姆斯的判决
item.description: 周一，美国一家法院维持了对 Theranos 公司创始人伊丽莎白-霍姆斯（Elizabeth Holmes）和总裁拉梅什-"桑尼"-巴尔瓦尼（Ramesh "Sunny" Balwani）的判决，他们被控在这家失败的血液检测初创公司中欺诈投资者，这家公司的估值曾高达 90 亿美元。【原文：A U.S. court upheld the convictions of Theranos' founder Elizabeth Holmes and President Ramesh "Sunny" Balwani on Monday, on charges of defrauding investors in the failed blood testing startup once valued at $9 billion.】

item.title: 英伟达将欧盟反垄断监管机构告上法庭，指控其调查人工智能初创公司 Run:ai 的竞购案
item.description: 美国芯片制造商英伟达（Nvidia）起诉欧盟反垄断监管机构，称其去年接受了意大利关于审查其收购人工智能初创公司Run:ai的请求，并称监管机构藐视了早前法院关于限制其对小型交易的兼并权的裁决。【原文：U.S. chipmaker Nvidia has sued EU antitrust regulators for accepting an Italian request last year to scrutinise its acquisition of AI startup Run:ai, saying they had flouted an earlier court ruling restricting their merger powers on minor deals.】

item.title: Palliser 要求力拓就两地上市寻求澳大利亚股东投票表决
item.description: 总部位于伦敦的对冲基金 Palliser Capital 周一敦促力拓公司允许其澳大利亚股东就一项寻求对其双重上市地位进行独立审查的决议进行投票。【原文：London-based hedge fund Palliser Capital on Monday urged Rio Tinto , to allow the company's Australian shareholders to vote on a resolution that seeks an independent review of its dual-listing status.】

item.title: 德国联盟谈判引人关注，欧元高位回落，美元走高
item.description: 欧元在德国保守派赢得大选后短暂反弹，周一从早些时候的高点回落，因为人们的焦点转向了如何尽快组建联合政府。【原文：The euro pulled back from earlier highs on Monday after briefly rallying following the election victory of Germany's conservatives as the focus turned to how quickly a coalition government can be achieved.】

item.title: 世界黄金协会称黄金ETF吸引了2022年3月以来最大的单周资金流入
item.description: 世界黄金协会（WGC）周一的数据显示，上周实物支持的黄金交易所交易基金（ETF）创下了自2022年3月以来的最大单周流入量。【原文：Physically backed gold exchange-traded funds (ETFs) registered the largest weekly inflow since March 2022 last week, data by the World Gold Council (WGC) showed on Monday.】

item.title: 摩根大通为推动直接借贷再预留 500 亿美元
item.description: 摩根大通（JPMorgan Chase）周一表示，它将再拨出 500 亿美元用于推动直接借贷业务，这家华尔街巨头希望扩大其在快速增长的私人信贷市场的立足点。【原文：JPMorgan Chase said on Monday it was setting aside another $50 billion for its direct lending push, as the Wall Street giant looks to expand its foothold in the rapidly growing private credit market.】
